                                                                           â€“3â€“                                                                2225 â€“ 6709M


Subject Details: Physics HL Paper 2 Markscheme

Mark Allocation
Candidates are required to answer ALL questions. Maximum total = [90 marks].

   1.  Each row in the â€œQuestionâ€ column relates to the smallest subpart of the question.
   2.  The maximum mark for each question subpart is indicated in the â€œTotalâ€ column.
   3.  Each marking point in the â€œAnswersâ€ column is shown by means of a tick (âœ”) at the end of the marking point.
   4.  A question subpart may have more marking points than the total allows. This will be indicated by â€œmaxâ€ written after the mark in the â€œTotalâ€ column.
       The related rubric, if necessary, will be outlined in the â€œNotesâ€ column.
   5. For numerical answers, a correct answer with no working is awarded full marks UNLESS stated otherwise in the â€œNotesâ€. For correct numerical
       answers with working the working must be checked. If the working contains minor omissions or errors full marks are awarded. If the working
       contains wrong Physics or wrong method the correct answer obtained will be the result of numerical coincidence. In that case the answer is
       penalized.
   6. An alternative wording is indicated in the â€œAnswersâ€ column by a slash (/). Either wording can be accepted.
   7. An alternative answer is indicated in the â€œAnswersâ€ column by â€œORâ€ between the alternatives. Either answer can be accepted.
   8. Words in angled brackets Â« Â» in the â€œAnswersâ€ column are not necessary to gain the mark.
   9. The order of marking points does not have to be as in the â€œAnswersâ€ column, unless stated otherwise in the â€œNotesâ€ column.
   10. If the candidateâ€™s answer has the same â€œmeaningâ€ or can be clearly interpreted as being of equivalent significance, detail and validity as that in the
       â€œAnswersâ€ column then award the mark.
   11. Remember that many candidates are writing in a second language. Effective communication is more important than grammatical accuracy.
   12. Occasionally, a part of a question may require an answer that is required for subsequent marking points. If an error is made in a marking point then
       it should be penalized. However, if the incorrect answer is used correctly in subsequent marking points then error carried forward (ECF) marks
       should be awarded. When marking, indicate this by adding ECF on the script. When ECF is not to be applied â€œDo not allow ECFâ€ will be displayed in
       the â€œNotesâ€ column.
   13. Do not penalize candidates for errors in units or significant figures, unless it is specifically referred to in the â€œNotesâ€ column.
   14. Allow alternative formats such as c for rad or use of E for scientific notation.

                  ALTERNATIVE 2                                                                      must be checked.

                  âˆ†ğ‘šğ‘š = 4 Ã— 938 + 2 Ã— 0.511 âˆ’ 4.001506 Ã— 931.5 â‰ª= 25.6 ğ‘€ğ‘€ğ‘€ğ‘€ğ‘€ğ‘€ ğ‘ğ‘ âˆ’2 â‰« ïƒ¼              Award [1] max if electrons are omitted.

       d    ii    <<Photons emitted>> in fusion give rise to outward/ thermal/radiation pressure ïƒ¼   For MP1, outward/thermal/ radiation

e   ii   The Sun only fuses hydrogen <<to helium>>                                        MP1 is about what is fusing to what
         OR                                                                               Do not allow ECF from white dwarf for
                                                                                          MP1
         Antares allows heavier elements Â«than hydrogenÂ» to be fused
         OR
         Antares has fusion up to iron ïƒ¼
                                                                                          MP2 is about fusion rate/conditions for
         Fusion in Antares occurs at a greater rate Â«because of greater mass/later        fusion                                       3
         evolutionary stageÂ»
         OR
         Fusion in Antares requires a higher Â«coreÂ» temperature/density Â«because of
         greater mass/later evolutionary stageÂ» ïƒ¼
                                                                                          MP3 is about where fusion occurs
         Antares has regions/shells where different elements are fused Â«due to its late
         evolutionary stageÂ» ïƒ¼

Question 9 continued.

Question 9 continued.

       d    i     Lists any two of the following: amplitude of oscillation, period/frequency of           Accept mass and spring constant as
                  oscillation, magnetic field strength of the magnet, number of turns of the coil, area   factors affecting period or frequency.
                  of the coil, average distance between the coil and the magnet ïƒ¼
                                                                                                          Award [2 max] for answers that list and
                  States that the induced emf depends on the rate of change of flux linkage through       discuss one factor only.
                  the coil / quotes Faradayâ€™s law ïƒ¼
                  Correctly relates each of the factors listed for MP1 to the rate of change flux         Do not award MP3 and 4 for answers                4
                  linkage. This must include how the change in flux is affected, how the time is          which simply relate the factor to the
                  changed or how the rate of change of flux linkage is changed (one ïƒ¼ for each            emf. E.g. increasing the number of coils
                  factor) ïƒ¼ïƒ¼                                                                              increases the emf.
                  E.g. increased amplitude leads to a greater change Î”Î¦ <<in the same time>>;
                  reduced period means that the <<same>> change of flux occurs over a shorter             Allow â€˜rate of cutting fluxâ€™ or â€˜cutting field
                  time Î”t, increasing the number of coils increases the rate of change of flux linkage    linesâ€™ in MP3 and 4 but not in MP2.
                  <<so increasing the emf>>
       d    ii    A current is induced in the coil ïƒ¼                                                      Allow the induced emf causes a current
                                                                                                          in the coil

                  ALTERNATIVE 1
                                                                                                          MP2 and 3 can only be awarded from
                  This <<current>> gives rise to a magnetic field ïƒ¼
                                                                                                          one Alternative
                  The field <<due to the induced current>> opposes the motion of the magnet /                                                               3
                  produces a resistive magnetic force on the magnet <<due to Lenzâ€™s Law>>ïƒ¼
                  ALTERNATIVE 2
                  This current leads to a dissipation of electrical energy as heat in the resistor ïƒ¼
                  The source of this energy is the mechanical energy of the magnet Â«which
                  therefore decreasesÂ» ïƒ¼
